text: City centre street with cafés, shops and people walking by. The tourists are looking at a map on their phone.
Excuse me, can you help us, please? We’re looking for a bank.
Sure. There’s one just around the corner. Go straight ahead and turn right at the traffic lights. It’s next to a small pharmacy.
Medium shot – the tourists smiling and pointing at the map.
No, it’s only about five minutes on foot. It’s usually open until half past four.
Close-up – one of the tourists are checking their phone.
Great, thank you. Are there any good restaurants near the bank?
Yes, there’s a nice Italian restaurant opposite the bank. It’s called the Bella Roma.
That sounds perfect. Do they serve vegetarian food?
Yes, they do. My sister often goes there. She says the pasta is really delicious.
Close-up of a mobile phone screen showing a map.
The map has three clear markers:
And is there a cinema close to the restaurant?
Yes, there is. Go past the restaurant, cross the main road and you’ll see the cinema on your right.
You’re welcome. Enjoy your day in the capital.
